title: Checks and balances
excerpt: Checks and balances are an  effective way  to slow down (and overturn) the impact of any one far-reaching decision—a great way to prevent misguided behavior (and mistakes) in politics.

That’s because when something needs doing—when taking the lead and calling the shots can produce better than average outcomes—layers of bureaucracy often hurts more it helps.
Indeed, increased vigilance and regulated-agency tend to stifle
